name: src/combined/index.js
CombinedRender
description: A renderer-wrapper to combine the individual aspects of renderers into a single scene, e.g. render a player and a block at once

params.name: options
params.description: The options for this renderer, see {@link defaultOptions}

params.name: element
params.description: DOM Element to attach the renderer to - defaults to document.body

name: init
description: Initializes the renderer - This has to be called before {@link render}

params.name: renders
params.description: Array of render objects

name: render
description: Starts rendering - This has to be called after {@link init}

name: src/entity/index.js

properties.name: assetRoot
properties.description: root to get asset files from

name: EntityRender
description: A renderer for Minecraft entities

params.name: options
params.description: The options for this renderer, see {@link defaultOptions}

params.name: options.assetRoot
params.description: root to get asset files from

params.name: element
params.description: DOM Element to attach the renderer to - defaults to document.body

name: src/gui/guiHelper.js
guiHelper
description: Helper functions for GUI creation

name: src/gui/guiPositions.js
guiPositions
description: Definition of positions/UV mappings ov Minecraft GUI assets

name: src/gui/index.js

properties.name: assetRoot
properties.description: root to get asset files from

name: GuiRender
description: A renderer for Minecraft GUIs

params.name: options
params.description: The options for this renderer, see {@link defaultOptions}

params.name: options.assetRoot
params.description: root to get asset files from

params.name: element
params.description: DOM Element to attach the renderer to - defaults to document.body

name: render
description: Does the actual rendering

params.name: layers
params.description: Array of GUI layers - either strings or objects

params.name: layers[].texture
params.description: path to the layer's texture (starting at assets/minecraft/textures/), e.g. '/items/apple'

params.name: layers[].textureScale
params.description: scale of the given texture, can be used to get different sized textures aligned proerly

params.name: layers[].uv
params.description: [x1,y1,x2,y2] array UV mapping of the texture

params.name: layers[].pos
params.description: [x,y] array position of the layer

params.name: cb
params.description: Callback when rendering finished

name: src/lib/marchingSquares.js
contour
description: Computes a contour for a given input grid function using the marching squares algorithm. Returns the contour polygon as an array of points.

params.name: grid
params.description:
a two-input function(x, y) that returns true for values
inside the contour and false for values outside the contour.

params.name: start
params.description: an optional starting point [x, y] on the grid.

name: src/lib/OrbitControls.js
src/model/index.js

properties.name: type
properties.description: alternative way to specify the model type (block/item)

properties.name: assetRoot
properties.description: root to get asset files from

name: ModelRender
description: A renderer for Minecraft models, i.e. blocks & items

params.name: options
params.description: The options for this renderer, see {@link defaultOptions}

params.name: options.assetRoot
params.description: root to get asset files from

params.name: element
params.description: DOM Element to attach the renderer to - defaults to document.body

name: render
description: Does the actual rendering

params.name: models
params.description: Array of models to render - Either strings in the format <block|item>/<model name> or objects

params.name: models[].type
params.description: either 'block' or 'item'

params.name: models[].model
params.description: if 'type' is given, just the block/item name otherwise '<block|item>/<model name>'

params.name: models[].offset
params.description: [x,y,z] array of the offset

params.name: models[].rotation
params.description: [x,y,z] array of the rotation

params.name: models[].blockstate
params.description: name of a blockstate to be used to determine the models (only for blocks)

params.name: models[].variant
params.description: if 'blockstate' is given, the block variant to use

params.name: cb
params.description: Callback when rendering finished

name: src/model/modelConverter.js
structureToModels
description: Converts a {@link https://minecraft.gamepedia.com/Structure_block_file_format|Minecraft structure file} to models

params.name: structure
params.description: structure file info

params.name: structure.url
params.description: URL to a structure file

params.name: structure.file
params.description: uploaded file

params.name: structure.raw
params.description: Raw NBT data

name: ModelConverter
description: Helper to convert multi-block structures to models used by {@link ModelRender}

name: src/renderBase.js
DEFAULT_ROOT
description: Default asset root

name: textureCache
description: Texture cache

name: textureCallbacks
description: Texture callbacks

name: modelCache
description: Model cache

name: modelCallbacks
description: Model callbacks

properties.name: camera.target
properties.description: [x,y,z] array where the camera should look

name: Render
description: Base class for all Renders

params.name: options
params.description: The options for this renderer, see {@link defaultOptions}

params.name: defOptions
params.description: Additional default options, provided by the individual renders

params.name: element
params.description: DOM Element to attach the renderer to - defaults to document.body

name: element
description: DOM Element to attach the renderer to

name: options
description: Combined options

unknown.tagValue: {string} The content of the renderer's canvas as a Base64 encoded image

params.name: trim
params.description: whether to trim transparent pixels

params.name: mime
params.description: mime type of the image

return.description: The content of the renderer's canvas as a Base64 encoded image

name: toObj
description: Export the current scene content in the .obj format (only geometries, no textures)

name: toGLTF
description: Export the current scene content in the .gltf format (geometries + textures)

unknown.tagValue: {Promise<any>} a promise which resolves with the .gltf file content

return.description: a promise which resolves with the .gltf file content

name: initScene
description: Initializes the scene

name: addToScene
description: Adds an object to the scene & sets userData.renderType to this renderer's type

params.name: toAdd
params.description: object to add

name: clearScene
description: Clears the scene

params.name: onlySelfType
params.description: whether to remove only objects whose type is equal to this renderer's type (useful for combined render)

name: loadTextureAsBase64
description: Loads a Mincraft texture an returns it as Base64

params.name: root
params.description: Asset root, see {@link DEFAULT_ROOT}

params.name: namespace
params.description: Namespace, usually 'minecraft'

params.name: dir
params.description: Directory of the texture

params.name: name
params.description: Name of the texture

name: loadTexture
description: Load a texture as base64 - shouldn't be used directly

name: loadBlockState
description: Loads a blockstate file and returns the contained JSON

params.name: state
params.description: Name of the blockstate

params.name: assetRoot
params.description: Asset root, see {@link DEFAULT_ROOT}

name: loadJsonFromPath
description: Loads a model file and returns the contained JSON

params.name: root
params.description: Asset root, see {@link DEFAULT_ROOT}

params.name: path
params.description: Path to the model file

name: loadJsonFromPath_
description: Load a model - shouldn't used directly

name: scaleUv
description: Scales UV values

params.name: uv
params.description: UV value

name: src/skin/index.js
SkinRender
description: A renderer for Minecraft player models/skins

params.name: options
params.description: The options for this renderer, see {@link defaultOptions}

params.name: element
params.description: DOM Element to attach the renderer to - defaults to document.body

name: render
description: Does the actual rendering

params.name: texture
params.description: The texture to render - May be a string with the playername/URL/Base64 or an Object

params.name: texture.url
params.description: URL to the texture image

params.name: texture.data
params.description: Base64 encoded image data of the texture

params.name: texture.username
params.description: Player username

params.name: texture.uuid
params.description: Player UUID

params.name: texture.mineskin
params.description: ID of a MineSkin.org skin

params.name: texture.slim
params.description: Whether the provided texture uses the slim skin format

params.name: texture.capeUrl
params.description: URL to a cape texture

params.name: texture.capeData
params.description: Base64 encoded image data of the cape texture

params.name: texture.mineskin
params.description: ID of a MineSkin.org skin with a cape

params.name: texture.optifine
params.description: Whether the provided cape texture is an optifine cape

params.name: cb
params.description: Callback when rendering finished

name: src/skin/texturePositions.js
texturePositions
description: Texture positions for Minecraft's player model
